Quotes: Allow the president to invade a neighboring nation, whenever he shall deem it necessary to repel an invasion, and you allow him to do so whenever he may choose to say he deems it necessary for such a purpose - and you allow him to make war at pleasure.
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quotes: Stupidity has a knack of getting its way.
Author: Albert Camus

Quotes: Great spirits have always encountered violent opposition from mediocre minds.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quotes: Nationalism is an infantile disease. It is the measles of mankind.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quotes: The only shame is to have none.
Author: Blaise Pascal

Quotes: Any man can make mistakes, but only an idiot persists in his error.
Author: Cicero

Quotes: Any man is liable to err, only a fool persists in error.
Author: Cicero

Quotes: Ridicule dishonors a man more than dishonor does.
Author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

Quotes: Mediocre minds usually dismiss anything which reaches beyond their own understanding.
Author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

Quotes: Patriotism is your conviction that this country is superior to all others because you were born in it.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quotes: He knows nothing and thinks he knows everything. That points clearly to a political career.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quotes: When a stupid man is doing something he is ashamed of, he always declares that it is his duty.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quotes: It is dangerous to be sincere unless you are also stupid.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quotes: Military intelligence is a contradiction in terms.
Author: Groucho Marx

Quotes: A bore is a person who opens his mouth and puts his feats in it.
Author: Henry Ford

Quotes: Hatred is something peculiar. You will always find it strongest and most violent where there is the lowest degree of culture.
Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

Quotes: It is better to remain silent and be thought a fool than to open one's mouth and remove all doubt.
Author: Mark Twain

Quotes: The trouble ain't that there is too many fools, but that the lightning ain't distributed right.
Author: Mark Twain

Quotes: It is better to keep your mouth closed and let people think you are a fool than to open it and remove all doubt.
Author: Mark Twain

Quotes: Reader, suppose you were an idiot. And suppose you were a member of Congress. But I repeat myself.
Author: Mark Twain

Quotes: Seriousness is the only refuge of the shallow.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quotes: Ignorance, the root and stem of all evil.
Author: Plato

Quotes: I don't mind what Congress does, as long as they don't do it in the streets and frighten the horses.
Author: Victor Hugo

Quotes: As long as people believe in absurdities they will continue to commit atrocities.
Author: Voltaire

Quotes: It is lamentable, that to be a good patriot one must become the enemy of the rest of mankind.
Author: Voltaire

Quotes: Prejudices are what fools use for reason.
Author: Voltaire

Quotes: Those who can make you believe absurdities can make you commit atrocities.
Author: Voltaire

Quotes: The most peaceable way for you, if you do take a thief, is, to let him show himself what he is and steal out of your company.
Author: William Shakespeare
